subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS generation, oxidative damage, and their direct role in aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction causing ROS overproduction leading to oxidative stress and accelerated aging.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage, and mitochondrial efficiency in lifespan modulation.
Describes mitochondrial ROS as a driver of aging and the role of antioxidant defenses.
Focuses on mitochondrial free radical generation and its impact on lifespan control.
Links mitochondrial ROS accumulation to astrocyte dysfunction and brain aging.
Centers on mitochondrial ROS accumulation and the role of uncoupling proteins in modulating ROS and aging.
Describes ROS production, mtDNA damage, and mitochondrial dysfunction as central to aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction and increased ROS production causing oxidative damage and aging.
Links mitochondrial ROS-driven oxidative stress to telomere shortening and replicative senescence.
Involves mitochondrial ubiquinone biosynthesis affecting ROS production and aging rate.
Focuses on mtDNA mutation accumulation driven by ROS and the vicious cycle accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial DNA reorganization, respiratory chain dysfunction, and mitochondrial dynamics affecting quality and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial quality control via fission/fusion, mitophagy, biogenesis, and repair mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitophagy defects impairing mitochondrial quality control and driving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hierarchical mitochondrial surveillance pathways including repair, dynamics, and mitophagy maintaining mitochondrial quality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial relatedness, selection, and bottlenecks preventing accumulation of defective mtDNA, preserving mitochondrial quality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial fragmentation and fusion/fission dynamics affecting protein distribution and mitochondrial quality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction to impaired protein homeostasis, highlighting quality control failure in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial DNA repair deficiency and its impact on mtDNA mutation accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Dynamics and Maintenance Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial maintenance failure, turnover decline, and sex-specific effects contributing to aging.
Focuses on mitonuclear balance and coevolution affecting mitochondrial function and lifespan.
Emphasizes mito-nuclear coevolution, compatibility, and epistatic interactions influencing aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial-nuclear epistasis and co-adaptation affecting mitochondrial function and longevity.
Describes mitokine-mediated immune-metabolic responses linked to mitochondrial stress signaling and systemic aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial metabolism decline, NAD+ depletion, and sirtuin/mTOR pathways linking mitochondrial function to aging.
Links mitochondrial energy production efficiency to cognitive aging and general health, integrating mitochondrial function with systemic aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial bioenergetic decline and dysfunction in brain aging, involving nuclear-mitochondrial interactions.
Describes calorie restriction-induced mitochondrial biogenesis and bioenergetic efficiency via nuclear signaling pathways.
